definition: to accumulate merit/to do good/to give to charity/virtuous actions

to amass/to accumulate/to store/measured quantity (such as area of volume)/product (the result of multiplication)/to integrate (math.)/to solve (or integrate) an ordinary differential equation (math.)/old/long-standing
Germany/German/abbr. for 德國|德国[De2 guo2]

sentences.english: when you’re not nice that the bad things happen.
sentences.chinese: 你不积德，就会有不好的事发生在你身上。

sentences.english: Now it's time to bank some good karma and make someone else's day.
sentences.chinese: 现在是我们积德振作他人的时候了。

sentences.english: The priest talked about eternal life as reward for living a good life.
sentences.chinese: 牧师谈论着人一生积德，作为回报，死后才能永生。

sentences.english: Is religion a force for good?
sentences.chinese: 宗教是诱导人们积德行善的力量吗？

sentences.english: Merit is nobody see, doing good has its own heaven knows.
sentences.chinese: 积德虽无人见，行善自有天知。

sentences.english: A little compassion is both seed for cultivating virtue and root for accumulating merits.
sentences.chinese: 一点慈悲，不但是积德种子，也是积福根苗。

sentences.english: It was too late though, and I felt that the kindest thing I could now would be walk away.
sentences.chinese: 然而太迟了，我感到此时走开才是最积德的事。

sentences.english: Do good deeds to earn the blessings of the Jade Emperor.
sentences.chinese: 行善积德，自有玉皇大帝保佑。

definition: to do good works/to be merciful
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
saving a life is more meritorious than building a seven-floor pagoda (idiom)
pinyin: jiu4 ren2 yi1 ming4 sheng4 zao4 qi1 ji2 fu2 tu2
related.word: 救人一命胜造七级浮屠
